intro: Syngonanthus acopanensis, commonly known as the Acopán aster, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Syngonanthus acopanensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
